Object.Name: Filling level
Object.Description1: The uCIFI filling level sensor measures how full and/or how empty a container (e.g. waste, fuel) is and reports it either in percentage or in centimeters. The filling level sensor may be complemented with a temperature sensor to compose a waste filling sensor that can also identify waste container fire.

Item.Name: Container height
Item.Description: Height of the container.

Item.Name: Actual filling percentage
Item.Description: Percentage of container filled with content.

Item.Name: Actual filling level
Item.Description: Height of content in the container.

Item.Name: High threshold
Item.Description: Threshold above which the container is considered full.

Item.Name: Container full
Item.Description: Set to True if the actual filling percentage is above the high threshold.

Item.Name: Low threshold
Item.Description: Threshold below which the container is considered empty.

Item.Name: Container empty
Item.Description: Set to True if the actual filling percentage is below the low threshold.

Item.Name: Average filling speed
Item.Description: Average percentage filled per day.

Item.Name: Average filling speed reset
Item.Description: Reset average filling speed.

Item.Name: Forecast full date
Item.Description: Next date at which the container should reach the high threshold.

Item.Name: Forecast empty date
Item.Description: Next date at which the container should reach the low threshold.

Item.Name: Container out of location
Item.Description: Set to True if the container is not at the location where it should be.

Item.Name: Container out of position
Item.Description: Set to True if the container is not in correct upright position.

Item.Name: Container width
Item.Description: Width of the container.

Item.Name: Container installation type
Item.Description: Type of the container. Examples are underground, above ground.

Item.Name: Container volume max
Item.Description: The maximum volume available in the container for waste items.

Item.Name: Filling sensor position
Item.Description: The position of the filling sensor inside the container.

Item.Name: Type of materials
Item.Description: The type of the materials the container can be filled with. Examples are plastic, glass.

Item.Name: Filling operations counter
Item.Description: Total amount of filling operations performed.

Item.Name: Reset filling operations counter
Item.Description: Total amount of filling operations performed.

Item.Name: Cover open
Item.Description: Set to true if the cover of the container is open and the filling level cannot be estimated. This is valid if the filling level sensor is installed under the cover of the bin.

Item.Name: Temperature alarm
Item.Description: Set to true if the sensor detects a fire using either a temperature sensor object.and/or a gas detection object.

Item.Name: Water infiltration alarm
Item.Description: Set to true if the sensor detects water infiltration or a high humidity level.

Item.Name: Timestamp
Item.Description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed.

Item.Name: Fractional Timestamp
Item.Description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Indicator
Item.Description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Level
Item.Description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.
